com.locuslabs.sdk.ibeacon

Class IBeacon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.locuslabs.sdk.ibeacon.IBeacon
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IBeaconData

    public class IBeacon
extends java.lang.Object
    The IBeacon class represents a single hardware iBeacon detected by an Android device. 
    An iBeacon is identified by a three part identifier based on the fields
 proximityUUID - a string UUID typically identifying the owner of a
                 number of ibeacons
 major - a 16 bit integer indicating a group of iBeacons
 minor - a 16 bit integer identifying a single iBeacon
    An iBeacon sends a Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) advertisement that contains these three identifiers, along with the calibrated tx power (in RSSI) of the iBeacon's Bluetooth transmitter. This class may only be instantiated from a BLE packet, and an RSSI measurement for the packet. The class parses out the three part identifier, along with the calibrated tx power. It then uses the measured RSSI and calibrated tx power to do a rough distance measurement (the accuracy field) and group it into a more reliable buckets of distance (the proximity field.)
    See Also:
    Region.matchesIBeacon(IBeacon iBeacon)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.Double accuracy
      A double that is an estimate of how far the iBeacon is away in meters.
      protected java.lang.String bluetoothAddress
      The bluetooth mac address
      protected int major
      A 16 bit integer typically used to represent a group of iBeacons
      protected int minor
      A 16 bit integer that identifies a specific iBeacon within a group
      protected java.lang.Integer proximity
      An integer with four possible values representing a general idea of how far the iBeacon is away
      static int PROXIMITY_FAR
      More than four meters away
      static int PROXIMITY_IMMEDIATE
      Less than half a meter away
      static int PROXIMITY_NEAR
      More than half a meter away, but less than four meters away
      static int PROXIMITY_UNKNOWN
      No distance estimate was possible due to a bad RSSI value or measured TX power
      protected java.lang.String proximityUuid
      A 16 byte UUID that typically represents the company owning a number of iBeacons Example: E2C56DB5-DFFB-48D2-B060-D0F5A71096E0
      protected int rssi
      The measured signal strength of the Bluetooth packet that led do this iBeacon detection.
      protected java.lang.Double runningAverageRssi
      If multiple RSSI samples were available, this is the running average
      protected long timestamp 
      protected int txPower
      The calibrated measured Tx power of the iBeacon in RSSI This value is baked into an iBeacon when it is manufactured, and it is transmitted with each packet to aid in the distance estimate

      • proximityUuid

        protected java.lang.String proximityUuid
        A 16 byte UUID that typically represents the company owning a number of iBeacons Example: E2C56DB5-DFFB-48D2-B060-D0F5A71096E0

      • major

        A 16 bit integer typically used to represent a group of iBeacons

      • minor

        protected int minor
        A 16 bit integer that identifies a specific iBeacon within a group

      • proximity

        protected java.lang.Integer proximity
        An integer with four possible values representing a general idea of how far the iBeacon is away
        See Also:
        PROXIMITY_IMMEDIATE, PROXIMITY_NEAR, PROXIMITY_FAR, PROXIMITY_UNKNOWN

      • accuracy

        protected java.lang.Double accuracy
        A double that is an estimate of how far the iBeacon is away in meters. This name is confusing, but is copied from the iOS7 SDK terminology. Note that this number fluctuates quite a bit with RSSI, so despite the name, it is not super accurate. It is recommended to instead use the proximity field, or your own bucketization of this value.

      • rssi

        protected int rssi
        The measured signal strength of the Bluetooth packet that led do this iBeacon detection.

      • txPower

        protected int txPower
        The calibrated measured Tx power of the iBeacon in RSSI This value is baked into an iBeacon when it is manufactured, and it is transmitted with each packet to aid in the distance estimate

      • bluetoothAddress

        protected java.lang.String bluetoothAddress
        The bluetooth mac address

      • runningAverageRssi

        protected java.lang.Double runningAverageRssi
        If multiple RSSI samples were available, this is the running average

      • timestamp

        protected long timestamp
